Address.name: Address
Address.description: The address that you want the Snowball or Snowballs associated with a specific job to be shipped to. Addresses are validated at the time of creation. The address you provide must be located within the serviceable area of your region. Although no individual elements of the Address are required, if the address is invalid or unsupported, then an exception is thrown.

Name.name: Name
Name.description: The name of a person to receive a Snowball at an address.

Company.name: Company
Company.description: The name of the company to receive a Snowball at an address.

Street1.name: Street1
Street1.description: The first line in a street address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

Street2.name: Street2
Street2.description: The second line in a street address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

Street3.name: Street3
Street3.description: The third line in a street address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

City.name: City
City.description: The city in an address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

StateOrProvince.name: StateOrProvince
StateOrProvince.description: The state or province in an address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

PrefectureOrDistrict.name: PrefectureOrDistrict
PrefectureOrDistrict.description: The prefecture or district in an address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

Landmark.name: Landmark
Landmark.description: A landmark listed in an address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

Country.name: Country
Country.description: The country in an address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

PostalCode.name: PostalCode
PostalCode.description: The postal code in an address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

PhoneNumber.name: PhoneNumber
PhoneNumber.description: The phone number associated with an address that a Snowball is to be delivered to.

JobId.name: JobId
JobId.description: The 39 character job ID for the job that you want to cancel, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

Address.name: Address
Address.description: The address that you want the Snowball shipped to.

AddressId.name: AddressId
AddressId.description: The automatically generated ID for a specific address. You'll use this ID when you create a job to specify which address you want the Snowball for that job shipped to.

JobType.name: JobType
JobType.description: Defines the type of job that you're creating.

Resources.name: Resources
Resources.description:
Defines the Amazon S3 buckets associated with this job.

With IMPORT jobs, you specify the bucket or buckets that your transferred data will be imported into.

With EXPORT jobs, you specify the bucket or buckets that your transferred data will be exported from. Optionally, you can also specify a KeyRange value. If you choose to export a range, you define the length of the range by providing either an inclusive BeginMarker value, an inclusive EndMarker value, or both. Ranges are UTF-8 binary sorted.

Description.name: Description
Description.description: Defines an optional description of this specific job, for example Important Photos 2016-08-11.

AddressId.name: AddressId
AddressId.description: The ID for the address that you want the Snowball shipped to.

KmsKeyARN.name: KmsKeyARN
KmsKeyARN.description: The KmsKeyARN that you want to associate with this job. KmsKeyARNs are created using the CreateKey AWS Key Management Service (KMS) API action.

RoleARN.name: RoleARN
RoleARN.description: The RoleARN that you want to associate with this job. RoleArns are created using the CreateRole AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) API action.

SnowballCapacityPreference.name: SnowballCapacityPreference
SnowballCapacityPreference.description: If your job is being created in one of the US regions, you have the option of specifying what size Snowball you'd like for this job. In all other regions, Snowballs come with 80 TB in storage capacity.

ShippingOption.name: ShippingOption
ShippingOption.description:
The shipping speed for this job. Note that this speed does not dictate how soon you'll get the Snowball, rather it represents how quickly the Snowball moves to its destination while in transit. Regional shipping speeds are as follows:

  • In Australia, you have access to express shipping. Typically, Snowballs shipped express are delivered in about a day.

  • In the European Union (EU), you have access to express shipping. Typically, Snowballs shipped express are delivered in about a day. In addition, most countries in the EU have access to standard shipping, which typically takes less than a week, one way.

  • In India, Snowballs are delivered in one to seven days.

  • In the US, you have access to one-day shipping and two-day shipping.

Notification.name: Notification
Notification.description: Defines the Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) notification settings for this job.

JobId.name: JobId
JobId.description: The automatically generated ID for a job, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

DataTransfer.name: DataTransfer
DataTransfer.description: Defines the real-time status of a Snowball's data transfer while the appliance is at AWS. Note that this data is only available while a job has a JobState value of InProgress, for both import and export jobs.

BytesTransferred.name: BytesTransferred
BytesTransferred.description: The number of bytes transferred between a Snowball and Amazon S3.

ObjectsTransferred.name: ObjectsTransferred
ObjectsTransferred.description: The number of objects transferred between a Snowball and Amazon S3.

TotalBytes.name: TotalBytes
TotalBytes.description: The total bytes of data for a transfer between a Snowball and Amazon S3. This value is set to 0 (zero) until all the keys that will be transferred have been listed.

TotalObjects.name: TotalObjects
TotalObjects.description: The total number of objects for a transfer between a Snowball and Amazon S3. This value is set to 0 (zero) until all the keys that will be transferred have been listed.

AddressId.name: AddressId
AddressId.description: The automatically generated ID for a specific address.

Address.name: Address
Address.description: The address that you want the Snowball or Snowballs associated with a specific job to be shipped to.

NextToken.name: NextToken
NextToken.description: HTTP requests are stateless. To identify what object comes "next" in the list of ADDRESS objects, you have the option of specifying a value for NextToken as the starting point for your list of returned addresses.

Addresses.name: Addresses
Addresses.description: The Snowball shipping addresses that were created for this account.

NextToken.name: NextToken
NextToken.description: HTTP requests are stateless. If you use the automatically generated NextToken value in your next DescribeAddresses call, your list of returned addresses will start from this point in the array.

JobId.name: JobId
JobId.description: The automatically generated ID for a job, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

JobMetadata.name: JobMetadata
JobMetadata.description: Information about a specific job, including shipping information, job status, and other important metadata.

SubJobMetadata.name: SubJobMetadata
SubJobMetadata.description: Information about a specific job part (in the case of an export job), including shipping information, job status, and other important metadata.

JobId.name: JobId
JobId.description: The ID for a job that you want to get the manifest file for, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

ManifestURI.name: ManifestURI
ManifestURI.description: The Amazon S3 presigned URL for the manifest file associated with the specified JobId value.

JobId.name: JobId
JobId.description: The ID for the job that you want to get the UnlockCode value for, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

UnlockCode.name: UnlockCode
UnlockCode.description: The UnlockCode value for the specified job. The UnlockCode value can be accessed for up to 90 days after the job has been created.

SnowballLimit.name: SnowballLimit
SnowballLimit.description: The service limit for number of Snowballs this account can have at once. The default service limit is 1 (one).

SnowballsInUse.name: SnowballsInUse
SnowballsInUse.description: The number of Snowballs that this account is currently using.

JobListEntry.name: JobListEntry
JobListEntry.description: Each JobListEntry object contains a job's state, a job's ID, and a value that indicates whether the job is a job part, in the case of an export job.

JobId.name: JobId
JobId.description: The automatically generated ID for a job, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

IsMaster.name: IsMaster
IsMaster.description: A value that indicates that this job is a master job. A master job represents a successful request to create an export job. Master jobs aren't associated with any Snowballs. Instead, each master job will have at least one job part, and each job part is associated with a Snowball. It might take some time before the job parts associated with a particular master job are listed, because they are created after the master job is created.

JobLogs.name: JobLogs
JobLogs.description:
Contains job logs. Whenever Snowball is used to import data into or export data out of Amazon S3, you'll have the option of downloading a PDF job report. Job logs are returned as a part of the response syntax of the DescribeJob action in the JobMetadata data type. The job logs can be accessed for up to 60 minutes after this request has been made. To access any of the job logs after 60 minutes have passed, you'll have to make another call to the DescribeJob action.

For import jobs, the PDF job report becomes available at the end of the import process. For export jobs, your job report typically becomes available while the Snowball for your job part is being delivered to you.

The job report provides you insight into the state of your Amazon S3 data transfer. The report includes details about your job or job part for your records.

For deeper visibility into the status of your transferred objects, you can look at the two associated logs: a success log and a failure log. The logs are saved in comma-separated value (CSV) format, and the name of each log includes the ID of the job or job part that the log describes.

JobCompletionReportURI.name: JobCompletionReportURI
JobCompletionReportURI.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job completion report is located.

JobSuccessLogURI.name: JobSuccessLogURI
JobSuccessLogURI.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job success log is located.

JobFailureLogURI.name: JobFailureLogURI
JobFailureLogURI.description: A link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL where the job failure log is located.

JobMetadata.name: JobMetadata
JobMetadata.description: Contains information about a specific job including shipping information, job status, and other important metadata. This information is returned as a part of the response syntax of the DescribeJob action.

JobId.name: JobId
JobId.description: The automatically generated ID for a job, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

Resources.name: Resources
Resources.description: An array of S3Resource objects. Each S3Resource object represents an Amazon S3 bucket that your transferred data will be exported from or imported into.

Description.name: Description
Description.description: The description of the job, provided at job creation.

KmsKeyARN.name: KmsKeyARN
KmsKeyARN.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key associated with this job. This ARN was created using the CreateKey API action in AWS KMS.

RoleARN.name: RoleARN
RoleARN.description: The role ARN associated with this job. This ARN was created using the CreateRole API action in AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM).

AddressId.name: AddressId
AddressId.description: The ID for the address that you want the Snowball shipped to.

ShippingDetails.name: ShippingDetails
ShippingDetails.description: A job's shipping information, including inbound and outbound tracking numbers and shipping speed options.

SnowballCapacityPreference.name: SnowballCapacityPreference
SnowballCapacityPreference.description: The Snowball capacity preference for this job, specified at job creation. In US regions, you can choose between 50 TB and 80 TB Snowballs. All other regions use 80 TB capacity Snowballs.

Notification.name: Notification
Notification.description: The Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) notification settings associated with a specific job. The Notification object is returned as a part of the response syntax of the DescribeJob action in the JobMetadata data type.

DataTransferProgress.name: DataTransferProgress
DataTransferProgress.description: A value that defines the real-time status of a Snowball's data transfer while the appliance is at AWS. Note that this data is only available while a job has a JobState value of InProgress, for both import and export jobs.

JobLogInfo.name: JobLogInfo
JobLogInfo.description: Links to Amazon S3 presigned URLs for the job report and logs. For import jobs, the PDF job report becomes available at the end of the import process. For export jobs, your job report typically becomes available while the Snowball for your job part is being delivered to you.

JobResource.name: JobResource
JobResource.description: Contains an array of S3Resource objects. Each S3Resource object represents an Amazon S3 bucket that your transferred data will be exported from or imported into.

KeyRange.name: KeyRange
KeyRange.description: Contains a key range. For export jobs, a S3Resource object can have an optional KeyRange value. The length of the range is defined at job creation, and has either an inclusive BeginMarker, an inclusive EndMarker, or both. Ranges are UTF-8 binary sorted.

BeginMarker.name: BeginMarker
BeginMarker.description: The key that starts an optional key range for an export job. Ranges are inclusive and UTF-8 binary sorted.

EndMarker.name: EndMarker
EndMarker.description: The key that ends an optional key range for an export job. Ranges are inclusive and UTF-8 binary sorted.

NextToken.name: NextToken
NextToken.description: HTTP requests are stateless. To identify what object comes "next" in the list of JobListEntry objects, you have the option of specifying NextToken as the starting point for your returned list.

JobListEntries.name: JobListEntries
JobListEntries.description: Each JobListEntry object contains a job's state, a job's ID, and a value that indicates whether the job is a job part, in the case of export jobs.

NextToken.name: NextToken
NextToken.description: HTTP requests are stateless. If you use this automatically generated NextToken value in your next ListJobs call, your returned JobListEntry objects will start from this point in the array.

Notification.name: Notification
Notification.description:
The Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) notification settings associated with a specific job. The Notification object is returned as a part of the response syntax of the DescribeJob action in the JobMetadata data type.

When the notification settings are defined during job creation, you can choose to notify based on a specific set of job states using the JobStatesToNotify array of strings, or you can specify that you want to have Amazon SNS notifications sent out for all job states with NotifyAll set to true.

SnsTopicARN.name: SnsTopicARN
SnsTopicARN.description:
The new SNS TopicArn that you want to associate with this job. You can create Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for topics by using the CreateTopic Amazon SNS API action.

Note that you can subscribe email addresses to an Amazon SNS topic through the AWS Management Console, or by using the Subscribe AWS Simple Notification Service (SNS) API action.

JobStatesToNotify.name: JobStatesToNotify
JobStatesToNotify.description: The list of job states that will trigger a notification for this job.

NotifyAll.name: NotifyAll
NotifyAll.description: Any change in job state will trigger a notification for this job.

S3Resource.name: S3Resource
S3Resource.description: Each S3Resource object represents an Amazon S3 bucket that your transferred data will be exported from or imported into. For export jobs, this object can have an optional KeyRange value. The length of the range is defined at job creation, and has either an inclusive BeginMarker, an inclusive EndMarker, or both. Ranges are UTF-8 binary sorted.

BucketArn.name: BucketArn
BucketArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon S3 bucket.

KeyRange.name: KeyRange
KeyRange.description: For export jobs, you can provide an optional KeyRange within a specific Amazon S3 bucket. The length of the range is defined at job creation, and has either an inclusive BeginMarker, an inclusive EndMarker, or both. Ranges are UTF-8 binary sorted.

Shipment.name: Shipment
Shipment.description: The Status and TrackingNumber information for an inbound or outbound shipment.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: Status information for a shipment. Valid statuses include NEW, IN_TRANSIT, and DELIVERED.

TrackingNumber.name: TrackingNumber
TrackingNumber.description:
The tracking number for this job. Using this tracking number with your region's carrier's website, you can track a Snowball as the carrier transports it.

For India, the carrier is Amazon Logistics. For all other regions, UPS is the carrier.

ShippingDetails.name: ShippingDetails
ShippingDetails.description: A job's shipping information, including inbound and outbound tracking numbers and shipping speed options.

ShippingOption.name: ShippingOption
ShippingOption.description:
The shipping speed for a particular job. Note that this speed does not dictate how soon you'll get the Snowball from the job's creation date. This speed represents how quickly it moves to its destination while in transit. Regional shipping speeds are as follows:

  • In Australia, you have access to express shipping. Typically, Snowballs shipped express are delivered in about a day.

  • In the European Union (EU), you have access to express shipping. Typically, Snowballs shipped express are delivered in about a day. In addition, most countries in the EU have access to standard shipping, which typically takes less than a week, one way.

  • In India, Snowballs are delivered in one to seven days.

  • In the United States of America (US), you have access to one-day shipping and two-day shipping.

InboundShipment.name: InboundShipment
InboundShipment.description: The Status and TrackingNumber values for a Snowball being delivered to the address that you specified for a particular job.

OutboundShipment.name: OutboundShipment
OutboundShipment.description: The Status and TrackingNumber values for a Snowball being returned to AWS for a particular job.

JobId.name: JobId
JobId.description: The job ID of the job that you want to update, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

RoleARN.name: RoleARN
RoleARN.description: The new role Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that you want to associate with this job. To create a role ARN, use the CreateRole AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) API action.

Resources.name: Resources
Resources.description: The updated S3Resource object (for a single Amazon S3 bucket or key range), or the updated JobResource object (for multiple buckets or key ranges).

ShippingOption.name: ShippingOption
ShippingOption.description: The updated shipping option value of this job's ShippingDetails object.

Description.name: Description
Description.description: The updated description of this job's JobMetadata object.

SnowballCapacityPreference.name: SnowballCapacityPreference
SnowballCapacityPreference.description: The updated SnowballCapacityPreference of this job's JobMetadata object. Note that the 50 TB Snowballs are only available in the US regions.

title: Amazon Import/Export Snowball
description: AWS Import/Export Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transport solution that uses secure appliances to transfer large amounts of data between your on-premises data centers and Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3). The Snowball commands described here provide access to the same functionality that is available in the AWS Snowball Management Console, which enables you to create and manage jobs for Snowball. To transfer data locally with a Snowball appliance, you'll need to use the Snowball client or the Amazon S3 API adapter for Snowball. For more information, see the User Guide.

methods.description: Cancels the specified job. Note that you can only cancel a job before its JobState value changes to PreparingAppliance. Requesting the ListJobs or DescribeJob action will return a job's JobState as part of the response element data returned.

CancelJob.name: CancelJob
CancelJob.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Creates an address for a Snowball to be shipped to.  Addresses are validated at the time of creation. The address you provide must be located within the serviceable area of your region. If the address is invalid or unsupported, then an exception is thrown.

CreateAddress.name: CreateAddress
CreateAddress.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Creates a job to import or export data between Amazon S3 and your on-premises data center. Note that your AWS account must have the right trust policies and permissions in place to create a job for Snowball. For more information, see api-reference-policies.

CreateJob.name: CreateJob
CreateJob.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Takes an AddressId and returns specific details about that address in the form of an Address object.

DescribeAddress.name: DescribeAddress
DescribeAddress.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Returns a specified number of ADDRESS objects. Calling this API in one of the US regions will return addresses from the list of all addresses associated with this account in all US regions.

DescribeAddresses.name: DescribeAddresses
DescribeAddresses.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Returns information about a specific job including shipping information, job status, and other important metadata.

DescribeJob.name: DescribeJob
DescribeJob.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Returns a link to an Amazon S3 presigned URL for the manifest file associated with the specified JobId value. You can access the manifest file for up to 60 minutes after this request has been made. To access the manifest file after 60 minutes have passed, you'll have to make another call to the GetJobManifest action. The manifest is an encrypted file that you can download after your job enters the WithCustomer status. The manifest is decrypted by using the UnlockCode code value, when you pass both values to the Snowball through the Snowball client when the client is started for the first time. As a best practice, we recommend that you don't save a copy of an UnlockCode value in the same location as the manifest file for that job. Saving these separately helps prevent unauthorized parties from gaining access to the Snowball associated with that job. Note that the credentials of a given job, including its manifest file and unlock code, expire 90 days after the job is created.

GetJobManifest.name: GetJobManifest
GetJobManifest.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Returns the UnlockCode code value for the specified job. A particular UnlockCode value can be accessed for up to 90 days after the associated job has been created. The UnlockCode value is a 29-character code with 25 alphanumeric characters and 4 hyphens. This code is used to decrypt the manifest file when it is passed along with the manifest to the Snowball through the Snowball client when the client is started for the first time. As a best practice, we recommend that you don't save a copy of the UnlockCode in the same location as the manifest file for that job. Saving these separately helps prevent unauthorized parties from gaining access to the Snowball associated with that job.

GetJobUnlockCode.name: GetJobUnlockCode
GetJobUnlockCode.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Returns information about the Snowball service limit for your account, and also the number of Snowballs your account has in use. Note that the default service limit for the number of Snowballs that you can have at one time is 1. If you want to increase your service limit, contact AWS Support.

GetSnowballUsage.name: GetSnowballUsage
GetSnowballUsage.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Returns an array of JobListEntry objects of the specified length. Each JobListEntry object contains a job's state, a job's ID, and a value that indicates whether the job is a job part, in the case of export jobs. Calling this API action in one of the US regions will return jobs from the list of all jobs associated with this account in all US regions.

ListJobs.name: ListJobs
ListJobs.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: While a job's JobState value is New, you can update some of the information associated with a job. Once the job changes to a different job state, usually within 60 minutes of the job being created, this action is no longer available.

UpdateJob.name: UpdateJob
UpdateJob.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url
